For each Cow purchased, Chick-fil-A will donate a @jessiereesfoundation branded NEGU Cow to be put in a JoyJar for a child battling cancer. Congrats Teemu on your unbelievable carreer and to the Hall of Fame, hard work pays off and you have really proved it! I had the honor to play and learn from you my rookie year which is something I will never forget! @sel8nneteemu #rolemodel #finishflash #swedesdolikefinns
caption_raw:
#Repost @hampuslindholm47 ・・・

caption:
#Repost @c_4owler (@get_repost)
 
I know I've posted this before but it was a really special moment for me. @sel8nneteemu is one of the greatest people I've ever met, let alone one of the best hockey players to ever live. I learned a lot from Teemu and for him to take the time to comfort me after a tough loss in the Olympics when he was on the winning side just shows the kind of person he is. Congratulations Teemu, nobody deserves it more.

caption:
When crossing off the 9 in our playoff wins countdown, who better to lend a hand than these two? #PaintItOrange
. . . .
Kai Quinonez, who has aplastic anemia, a rare, life-long condition, met the Ducks in 2015 through Make-A-Wish.  Now finishing eighth grade, Quinonez continues to pursue his passion for hockey and is already practicing with his high school team that is part of the Anaheim Ducks High School Hockey League.
caption_raw:
When crossing off the 9 in our playoff wins countdown, who better to lend a hand than these two? #PaintItOrange
. . . .
Kai Quinonez, who has aplastic anemia, a rare, life-long condition, met the Ducks in 2015 through Make-A-Wish.  Now finishing eighth grade, Quinonez continues to pursue his passion for hockey and is already practicing with his high school team that is part of the Anaheim Ducks High School Hockey League.

CHOC Night will take place this Sunday, March 5th at Honda Center. @chocchildrens volunteers will once again be selling the fan-favorite, limited edition stuffed Choco Bears outfitted in an Anaheim Ducks replica home jersey autographed by @anaheimducks players. Bears will be sold for $70 starting at 3pm outside of the South Doors.  In addition, half of the 50/50 jackpot for Sunday night's game will go to CHOC Children's! Don't miss your chance to support CHOC and be a 50/50 raffle winner!

caption: BREAKING: #NHLDucks Head Coach Bruce Boudreau has been relieved of his duties, Executive Vice President/General Manager Bob Murray announced. Murray will begin the search for a new head coach immediately.  I would like to thank Bruce for his hard work and dedication to the franchise,  said Murray.  This was a very difficult decision to make. Bruce is a good coach and character person, and we wish him the best of luck in the future.
caption_raw: BREAKING: #NHLDucks Head Coach Bruce Boudreau has been relieved of his duties, Executive Vice President/General Manager Bob Murray announced. Murray will begin the search for a new head coach immediately. “I would like to thank Bruce for his hard work and dedication to the franchise,” said Murray. “This was a very difficult decision to make. Bruce is a good coach and character person, and we wish him the best of luck in the future.”

caption:
#Repost @anaheimducksfoundation
 
@anaheimducks defenseman @hampuslindholm47 spent time this afternoon with Kai Quinonez at his middle school in Los Alamitos. Through a joint effort with the @makeawishocie, the #NHLDucks are granting Kai s wish to be an Anaheim Duck for a day. Kai will be a special guest of the Ducks tomorrow at @HondaCenter, where he will watch practice with his family, skate with the team, join the Ducks players for lunch and sign autographs as part of the players  autograph-signing session. Kai will also be part of the excitement of the Home Opener festivities on October 12.  I ve always wanted to meet and play hockey with Hampus Lindholm,  Kai says.  Ever since I first played hockey I have been a huge Ducks fan.
@nthompson44 the Great! You make 31 look good!

caption:
#Repost @davidofdaveart
 
No more Duckhunt  The lastest chapter of John Gibson s Anaheim Ducks masks is here  And for sure it is a new tribute to classic old school retro video games  Loaded with 100% pixels and 100% action!  The name of the design is No More Duckhunt  and that is exactly what it is ! On one side is that dog we all remember  chasing and catching ducks  He may look very happy  but not so much longer...  Watch out you dog  check out on the other side what is waiting for you  The Pixel Ducks friends is here, and it is Rambo Duck , ready to pay back!! He is holding his Zapper 2.0  and check it out  it is loaded with nuclear shots  Watch out doggy!  The mask is loaded with details all over the mask, just as the storybook it is  And for sure all the DAVEART Trademark Super FX . And Maybe Rambo Duck shot himself as well with the Nuclear Zapper  because his mask is glowing in the dark ! DAVEART GLOW Tech FX 2.0  delivers again.. Thanks John, I love to be your personal mask artist and create and paint your masks   John and me have more stuff in the pipeline, be ready!

Thank you all for your interest in my paintings :)  @johngibson36 @anaheimducks @nhl @davidofdaveart #nhl #johngibson #daveartthecradleofcreativity #daveart #daveartglow
caption_raw:
#Repost @davidofdaveart
・・・
No more Duckhunt…😬 The lastest chapter of John Gibson´s Anaheim Ducks masks is here… And for sure it is a new tribute to classic old school retro video games… Loaded with 100% pixels and 100% action!🐤👾 The name of the design is No More Duckhunt… and that is exactly what it is…! On one side is that dog we all remember🐶… chasing and catching ducks… He may look very happy… but not so much longer...😱 Watch out you dog… check out on the other side what is waiting for you… The Pixel Ducks friends is here, and it is Rambo Duck💣, ready to pay back!! He is holding his Zapper 2.0… and check it out… it is loaded with nuclear shots… Watch out doggy!😯🐶 The mask is loaded with details all over the mask, just as the storybook it is📚… And for sure all the DAVEART Trademark Super FX💎. And Maybe Rambo Duck shot himself as well with the Nuclear Zapper… because his mask is glowing in the dark…! DAVEART GLOW Tech FX 2.0💡 delivers again.. Thanks John, I love to be your personal mask artist and create and paint your masks 😃🎨 John and me have more stuff in the pipeline, be ready!

Thank you all for your interest in my paintings :)❤️ @johngibson36 @anaheimducks @nhl @davidofdaveart #nhl #johngibson #daveartthecradleofcreativity #daveart #daveartglow

caption:
Kids can spend an unforgettable four days learning all aspects of the game of ice hockey from professional coaches at the Anaheim Ducks Youth Camp at @the_rinks - Anaheim Ice. Each day will consist of fun drills on and off of the ice, scrimmages, and games. In addition, camp staff will help develop each participant using comprehensive instruction in a controlled, fun, and friendly environment. Plus, you never know who might drop in as a special guest!

For more info, head to the-rinks.com/summercamps

caption:
OFFICIAL: The Anaheim Ducks have acquired defenseman James Wisniewski and a third-round draft selection (2015; Detroit's selection from Columbus) from the Columbus Blue Jackets in exchange for William Karlsson, Rene Bourque and a 2015 second-round draft selection.

The Ducks have also acquired center Michael Sgarbossa from the Colorado Avalanche in exchange for defenseman Mat Clark.

The Ducks have also acquired center Michael Sgarbossa from the Colorado Avalanche in exchange for defenseman Mat Clark.

caption: #NHLDucks GM Bob Murray and Teemu Selanne met this week to discuss a possible contract. Below are quotes from Teemu, courtesy of the #ocregister: "He's always very clear, very honest. He said, 'Teemu, I'm more than happy to see you back. It's your decision. If you want to play, let's do it. "I wouldn't be here if I wasn't thinking about playing. But I haven't really made the final decision because I don't really have to yet."
caption_raw: #NHLDucks GM Bob Murray and Teemu Selanne met this week to discuss a possible contract. Below are quotes from Teemu, courtesy of the #ocregister: "He's always very clear, very honest. He said, 'Teemu, I'm more than happy to see you back. It's your decision. If you want to play, let's do it. "I wouldn't be here if I wasn't thinking about playing. But I haven't really made the final decision because I don't really have to yet."

caption: On this date in 1993, Paul Kariya became the first player drafted in #NHLDucks history. The left wing from Maine was selected fourth overall in the NHL Entry Draft. In 606 career games with the Ducks, Kariya scored 300 goals, collected 369 assists and recorded 669 points.
caption_raw: On this date in 1993, Paul Kariya became the first player drafted in #NHLDucks history. The left wing from Maine was selected fourth overall in the NHL Entry Draft. In 606 career games with the Ducks, Kariya scored 300 goals, collected 369 assists and recorded 669 points.

caption: USA Hockey named Ducks prospect John Gibson it's 2013 Bob Johnson Award winner, which recognizes excellence in international play. Gibson back stopped the U.S. National Junior Team to the gold medal at the IIHF World Junior Championship, setting the record for save percentage (.955). He followed that performance with another brilliant performance in the IIHF World Championships, helping the U.S. Men's National Team earn a bronze medal.
caption_raw: USA Hockey named Ducks prospect John Gibson it's 2013 Bob Johnson Award winner, which recognizes excellence in international play. Gibson back stopped the U.S. National Junior Team to the gold medal at the IIHF World Junior Championship, setting the record for save percentage (.955). He followed that performance with another brilliant performance in the IIHF World Championships, helping the U.S. Men's National Team earn a bronze medal.

caption:
Our photo trip down memory lane with prospect Brandon McMillan. Follow our Instagram feed or visit anaheimducks.com.
Brandon: I think I was 14 or 15, and it s a little spring hockey team we put together, and we won the tournament. There are a few AHL players in there. Right to my right is Tyler Johnson, who played in Norfolk last year and is now at Syracuse. Martin Jones, the goalie on the left, plays in Manchester. Patrick Wiercioch is right above Martin Jones and he plays in Binghamton. Right to the right of him is Landon Ferraro, who plays in Grand Rapids. Probably more than half of those guys still play hockey and a few of them play pro. Ray Ferraro, who played in the NHL for a lot of years and is now a TSN announcer, is on the far right. He was a coach on that team. It was a pretty good team. The coaches were making fun of me because I hadn t won anything before, so they let me hold the trophy. #nhlducks

Our photo trip down memory lane with prospect Brandon McMillan. Follow our Instagram feed or visit anaheimducks.com.
Brandon: I think I was 14 or 15, and it’s a little spring hockey team we put together, and we won the tournament. There are a few AHL players in there. Right to my right is Tyler Johnson, who played in Norfolk last year and is now at Syracuse. Martin Jones, the goalie on the left, plays in Manchester. Patrick Wiercioch is right above Martin Jones and he plays in Binghamton. Right to the right of him is Landon Ferraro, who plays in Grand Rapids. caption:
Follow our photo trip down memory lane with prospect Brandon McMillan on our Instagram feed or see the full story at anaheimducks.com.
Brandon: I ve never seen this picture before, but the sweatshirt comes from my dad s side of the family. They re all from Cold Lake, Alberta, north of Edmonton. That must have been my dad s old hockey gear because that helmet is made of foam and the gloves are pretty old. Those are definitely some antiques. #nhlducks

caption:
Our photo trip down memory lane with prospect Brandon McMillan. Follow our Instagram feed or visit Anaheimducks.com for full story.
Brandon: That s my sister Melissa and me. We re either camping or we re at a fireworks show in Vancouver. That s definitely a cute little picture of us. I got along with her when we were younger, but now she s in her teenage years and gets a little bit on my nerves. #nhlducks

caption:
Our photo trip down memory lane with prospect Brandon McMillan. Follow on Instagram or visit anaheimducks.com for the full story.
Brandon: That s probably one of the first days of one of my first years playing hockey. That was outside our house and I was heading out to morning practice. Back then you had to get ready at home and ride to the rink in all your gear. Those are classic Canucks jerseys. Those were the Canucks jerseys back then, and they wore those when they made it to the Stanley Cup Final in  94. #nhlducks

Our photo trip down memory lane with prospect Brandon McMillan. Follow on Instagram or visit anaheimducks.com for the full story.

caption:
A photo trip down memory lane with prospect Brandon McMillan. Follow our Instagram feed or visit anaheimducks.com for the full story.
Brandon: That was a plaque for Athlete of the Year for my school in Grade 7. I m there with my mom, dad and sister. I played basketball and ran track back then, along with hockey. I don t know where that Afro came from, but that was my style back in the day. I liked the long curly hair coming out of the back of the helmet, so I m looking to bring that back maybe. #nhlducks

caption:
Follow along on Instagram with our photo trip down memory lane with prospect Brandon McMillan. Full story at anaheimducks.com.
Brandon: This one with Mark Messier was the same day. It was pretty cool meeting a legend like him, and I got to meet him later in life when his son tried out for the Kelowna Rockets, where I was playing at the time. He s just a classy guy and one of the best hockey players to ever play. #NHLDucks

caption:
Follow our Instagram feed or visit anaheimducks.com for a photo trip down memory lane with prospect Brandon McMillan.
Brandon: That was a Meet the Canucks day, one of the highlights of my life when I was younger. I think I was 8 or 10 there and I lived in a little town called Tsawwassen, about 30 minutes from Vancouver. You got the opportunity to meet all the players. Todd Bertuzzi was my favorite player when I was growing up, so getting the chance to meet him was huge. And then obviously playing against him last year and the year before was a pretty cool experience as well. #nhlducks
